The 
              Southern Work Among 
             the Colored People. 

                                               -
 


              By Mrs. E. G. White. 

                                               -
 

To My Brethren and Sisters in America,-- 


     We are thankful that the light of Present Truth has been shining in the Southern States, and that a few laborers in this field have been working wholeheartedly to communicate the truth to the colored people. Those who have not borne the burden of opening up the work among the colored people, can know comparatively 
                                                                           13
little of the trials, the prayers, and the wrestling of those who have been pioneers in this work.
